pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw:
Following test instructions from this other PR (#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/57/integrate-traffic-shaper-script/diff) , but changing the branch to `tc_filter` , I got these results: 

```
Server listening on TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 85.3 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  4] local 192.168.2.150 port 5001 connected with 192.168.2.10 port 52674
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  4]  0.0-20.8 sec   640 KBytes   252 Kbits/sec
``` 

I can see the src_monitor is running in the FC machine . 
```
$ ps -ef | grep src_monitor
root      4940  4933  0 13:55 ?        00:00:00 /bin/bash /home/ubuntu/code/cloudsim-sim/src_commands/src_monitor.bash
root      5117  4940  2 13:55 ?        00:00:11 python /home/ubuntu/code/cloudsim-sim/src_commands/src_monitor.py fieldcomputer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZGVudGl0aWVzIjpbInByZXluYUBjcmVhdGl2YTc3LmNvbS5hciIsInNyYy1hZG1pbnMiLCJTUkMtZGVidWciXSwiaWF0IjoxNDk1NzQxMDg5LCJleHAiOjE1MTEyOTMwODl9.Cv4XJcih9i6aTJGdQQlpMnPlUnuuaRiyQJ_98awb5K951wxr0wT4MLjV1WI1h-ILOV8uF8dI-rT5FHyAS6Jm_Q
```

Is this resulting bandwith correct ?  I recall getting a 3.5 Kb in the previous version
content.html:
Following test instructions from this other PR (#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/57/integrate-traffic-shaper-script/diff) , but changing the branch to tc_filter , I got these results: 

Server listening on TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 85.3 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  4] local 192.168.2.150 port 5001 connected with 192.168.2.10 port 52674
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  4]  0.0-20.8 sec   640 KBytes   252 Kbits/sec

I can see the src_monitor is running in the FC machine . 

$ ps -ef | grep src_monitor
root      4940  4933  0 13:55 ?        00:00:00 /bin/bash /home/ubuntu/code/cloudsim-sim/src_commands/src_monitor.bash
root      5117  4940  2 13:55 ?        00:00:11 python /home/ubuntu/code/cloudsim-sim/src_commands/src_monitor.py fieldcomputer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZGVudGl0aWVzIjpbInByZXluYUBjcmVhdGl2YTc3LmNvbS5hciIsInNyYy1hZG1pbnMiLCJTUkMtZGVidWciXSwiaWF0IjoxNDk1NzQxMDg5LCJleHAiOjE1MTEyOTMwODl9.Cv4XJcih9i6aTJGdQQlpMnPlUnuuaRiyQJ_98awb5K951wxr0wT4MLjV1WI1h-ILOV8uF8dI-rT5FHyAS6Jm_Q

Is this resulting bandwith correct ? I recall getting a 3.5 Kb in the previous version

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw:
Now I saw in the code we have this:
```
if taskId == 1:
    uplink = "380kbit"
    downlink = "4kbit"
  elif taskId == 2:
```
so probably the resulting bandwith was OK  !
content.html:
Now I saw in the code we have this:

if taskId == 1:
    uplink = "380kbit"
    downlink = "4kbit"
  elif taskId == 2:

so probably the resulting bandwith was OK !

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw: 380kbit should be from FC (`iperf -c`) to OCU (`iperf -s`) but it looks like you have FC as the iperf server? In that case I would expect 4kbit
content.html: 380kbit should be from FC (iperf -c) to OCU (iperf -s) but it looks like you have FC as the iperf server? In that case I would expect 4kbit

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw: the above results are with the FC acting as the iperf client .   (the port 5001 is open in in 192.168.2.150)
content.html: the above results are with the FC acting as the iperf client . (the port 5001 is open in in 192.168.2.150)

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw: ah ok, then the results look good, thanks!
content.html: ah ok, then the results look good, thanks!

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw:
Regarding bandwith limits between FC and SIm , it seem it is working OK:
```
------------------------------------------------------------
Client connecting to 192.168.2.1, TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 45.0 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  3] local 192.168.2.10 port 39940 connected with 192.168.2.1 port 5001
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  3]  0.0-10.0 sec   282 MBytes   236 Mbits/sec
ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-244:~/code/cloudsim-sim/src_commands$ iperf -c 192.168.2.150
------------------------------------------------------------
```
content.html:
Regarding bandwith limits between FC and SIm , it seem it is working OK:

------------------------------------------------------------
Client connecting to 192.168.2.1, TCP port 5001

------------------------------------------------------------

ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-244:~/code/cloudsim-sim/src_commands$ iperf -c 192.168.2.150
------------------------------------------------------------

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw:
If using the FC as iperf server I get this (results printed in OCU terminal):
```
------------------------------------------------------------
Client connecting to 192.168.2.10, TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 45.0 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  3] local 192.168.2.150 port 58390 connected with 192.168.2.10 port 5001
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  3]  0.0-374.0 sec   256 KBytes  5.61 Kbits/sec
```
content.html:
If using the FC as iperf server I get this (results printed in OCU terminal):

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw: The printed number is not 4 Kbit/sec but almost there. So I think this is OK ? (or should we be very strict on these values?)
content.html: The printed number is not 4 Kbit/sec but almost there. So I think this is OK ? (or should we be very strict on these values?)

pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw:
OK, these are the same numbers but read from the iperf server (the FC ): 
```
$ iperf -s
------------------------------------------------------------
Server listening on TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 85.3 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  4] local 192.168.2.10 port 5001 connected with 192.168.2.150 port 58390
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  4]  0.0-677.2 sec   256 KBytes  3.10 Kbits/sec
```
Interestingly , from the server point of view, the bandwith was lower than 4Kbit/sec . So I think we are OK here.
content.html:
OK, these are the same numbers but read from the iperf server (the FC ): 

$ iperf -s
------------------------------------------------------------
Server listening on TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 85.3 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  4] local 192.168.2.10 port 5001 connected with 192.168.2.150 port 58390
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  4]  0.0-677.2 sec   256 KBytes  3.10 Kbits/sec

Interestingly , from the server point of view, the bandwith was lower than 4Kbit/sec . So I think we are OK here.

content.raw: ya it should be ok. They do not need to be exact.
content.html: ya it should be ok. They do not need to be exact.
